Body:
Most languages have either no articles, or one or both of the definite (akin to English "the") and indefinite (akin to English "a" / "an").

But are there other kinds of articles, and which languages have them?
Title: Do some languages have articles besides the definite and indefinite articles?

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
